split_operations.reason: Split by project phase. The first part covers initial planning, timeline setting, and deliverable coordination. The second part is a distinct, later conversation about handling client feedback and executing design revisions.

suggested_splits.title: EcoBloom Campaign: Initial Planning & Timeline Coordination
EcoBloom Campaign: Client Feedback & Color Palette Revision

split_operations.reason: Split by distinct deliverables and project phases. The cluster contains three separate topics: initial project kickoff and timeline planning, the specific development of brand voice guidelines, and a later, focused legal review for trademarks.

suggested_splits.title: FitFusion Rebrand: Kickoff, Contract & Timeline Planning
FitFusion Rebrand: Brand Voice Guidelines Development
FitFusion Rebrand: Legal Review & Trademark Clearance

split_operations.reason: Split by distinct discussion topics within a large project. The cluster is broken into initial planning, a specific conversation about product messaging and legal compliance for claims, and a separate, time-bound discussion on finalizing the campaign budget.

suggested_splits.title: TechNova Launch: Initial Planning & Timeline Coordination
TechNova Launch: Product Messaging & Legal Compliance

split_operations.reason: Split by a significant project event. The first part covers the general planning and execution of the sustainability report. The second part is a focused, distinct conversation about a client's request to extend the deadline and the team's approval.

suggested_splits.title: GreenScape Report: Planning, Content & Design Coordination
GreenScape Report: Client Deadline Extension Request & Approval

split_operations.reason: Split by deliverable type. The original cluster incorrectly grouped two separate projects for the same client: the development of a social media strategy and the planning for market research. These are distinct workstreams with different goals and timelines.

suggested_splits.title: UrbanEdge: Social Media Strategy & Content Templates
UrbanEdge: Market Research & Data Privacy Compliance

split_operations.reason: Split by project phase for an internal process. The conversation naturally divides into two stages: the initial phase of gathering requirements from different departments, and the subsequent phase of drafting, reviewing, and finalizing the content calendar.

suggested_splits.title: Q3 Content Calendar: Planning & Requirements Gathering
Q3 Content Calendar: Draft Review & Finalization

ai_operations.reasoning: Focused on splitting large, multi-topic clusters based on project phases (planning, execution, review), distinct deliverables (e.g., social media vs. market research), and specific events (e.g., budget finalization, deadline extension). This approach breaks down broad project discussions into more granular, actionable topics, resulting in 14 focused clusters from the original 6, which aligns with the goal of reaching 15-20 total clusters.
